did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Dept. of Textiles and Apparel records, 1942-2005.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology. Department of Textiles and Apparel

did.physdesc: Syllabi, reports, minutes, publications, and audiocasettes.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Annual reports, faculty meeting minutes, department newsletters, committee minutes, and other papers of the department. Also, material on course syllabi, outlines and descriptions of exhibits; audio cassettes of talks.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: Department was formed in 1985 upon the dividing of the Department of Design and Environmental Analysis into Textile and Apparel Department and Department of Interior Design, Planning and Management; Design and Environmental Analysis had evolved from the Department of Textile and Clothing, which was formed in 1925.
Department changed its name to Fiber Science and Apparel Design in the spring semester, 2007.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Annual reports, faculty meeting minutes, department newsletters, committee minutes, and other papers of the department; includes a history of the evolution of the department. Also, material on course syllabi, outlines and descriptions of exhibits, featuring Mary McFadden, and Jon Haggins; audiocassettes of talks by Mary Purchase and Anita Racine.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New York State College of Human Ecology.

descgrp.head: INFORMATION FOR USERS
descgrp.p: See also Dept. of Fiber Science and Apparel Design records #23-19-3780
See also New York State College of Home Economics records #23-2-749
See also New York State College of Human Ecology records #23-2-2817

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Dept. of Textiles and Apparel records, #23-19-2807. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Course Material

Series II. Exhibits

Series III. Meeting Minutes
Box 1, folders 14-23, 25-26

p.ref: C. News from the Department of Textiles and Clothing

arrangement.p:
Series V. Reports
Box 1, folders 3, 8-17, 34; Box 2, folders 107

Series VI. Subject Files
Box 1, folders 1-2, 4-7, 24, 31-33, Box 4 folders 1-11

Series VII. Audiocasette tapes
tr. 7767a and tr. 7768a

Series VIII. Projects and Proposal
Box 4 folders 12 - 17

Series IX. Graduate Programs
Box 5 folders 1 - 4, 11
